newsitem.title: USA: US chain store sales up 0.3 pct - BTM/Schroders.
newsitem.headline: US chain store sales up 0.3 pct - BTM/Schroders.

text.p: U.S. chain store sales rose 0.3 percent in the week ended October 12 from the prior week, according to the seasonally adjusted BTM/Schroders weekly chain store sales index.
Sales for the week were up 2.0 percent on a year-over-year basis, while the month-to-date index fell 0.7 percent from the prior month.
"The latest week's sales were generally on- to slightly above-plan for most retailers," a BTM/Schroders report said. Sales of Halloween-related merchandise were strong, the report added.
